body.directions: Listen to the audio, then complete the multiple choice questions that follow.

body.textVersion: Audio for 你的生日是什么时候 Nǐde shēngrì shì shénme shíhòu?

body.quiz: Which structure would you use to respond to the question in the audio?
body.correct: Job nicely done! The question “你的生日是什么时候？ Nǐde shēngrì shì shénme shíhòu? “ means “When is your birthday,” and to respond to it, you need to use the structure 我的生日是... Wǒde shēngrì shì… (My birthday is ….).
body.incorrect: Very close. Listen to the question in the audio again, think about its meaning, and then recall what structure you can use to form a response to match this meaning.

body.quiz: Which of the following sentences can be completed with the word in the audio?
body.answer: 一年有十二个_____。 Yīnián yǒu shíèr gè ____.
options: 请给我两_____米饭。 Qǐng gěiwǒ liǎng ___ mǐfàn.
我的眼睛是_____色的。 Wǒde yǎnjīng shì ____ sè de.
一杯果汁十二_____。 Yībēi guǒzhī shièr ____ .
body.correct: Outstanding! 月 yuè means month, and it suits the sentence 一年有十二个_____。 Yīnián yǒu shièr gè ____. very well with the meaning, “There are twelve months in a year.”
body.incorrect: Not quite. Listen to the word again. Identify its meaning, and then review the four sentences in the choices to see which you can fit the word into.

body.quiz: Which of the following numbers in Chinese cannot be reasonably used with the word in the audio?
body.correct: Outstanding job! 日 rì means “day” to describe the days in a month. The only number that can’t be the day in a month would be 三十六 sānshíliù (36).
body.incorrect: Not quite. Think about the meaning of the word in the audio, and then consider the range of numbers that can be used with it.

body.quiz: In which of the following situations can the verb in the audio be most reasonably used?
body.answer: At your best friend’s birthday party
options: After a disagreement with your friend
When you are preparing for a presentation
body.correct: Wonderfully done! 庆祝 qìngzhù means “celebrate.” Of the situations provided, your best friend’s birthday party is the most worth celebrating.
body.incorrect: Not quite. Listen to the word in the audio again, consider its meaning, and then review the situations in the choices to see which is the most reasonable for the action indicated by the word in the audio.
